notes.text:
An update for jenkins is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Jenkins is a continuous integration server that monitors executions of repeated jobs, such as building a software project or jobs run by cron.

Security Fix(es):

* jenkins: CSRF protection tokens for anonymous users did not expire in some circumstances (SECURITY-1491) (CVE-2019-10384)

* jenkins: stored cross-site scripting in update center web pages (SECURITY-1453) (CVE-2019-10383)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.16 jenkins security update

full_product_name.name: jenkins-0:2.176.3.1568229898-1.el7.noarch as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1
jenkins-0:2.176.3.1568229898-1.el7.src as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in Jenkins 2.191 and earlier, LTS 2.176.2 and earlier allowed attackers with Overall/Administer permission to configure the update site URL to inject arbitrary HTML and JavaScript in update center web pages.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: stored cross-site scripting in update center web pages (SECURITY-1453)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.1 see the following documentation, which
will be updated shortly for release 4.1.16, for important instructions on
how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata
update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.1/release_notes/ocp-4-1-release-notes.html

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins: stored cross-site scripting in update center web pages (SECURITY-1453)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Jenkins. Users are allowed to obtain CSRF tokens without an associated web session ID, resulting in CSRF tokens that did not expire and could be used to bypass CSRF protection for the anonymous user. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: CSRF protection tokens for anonymous users did not expire in some circumstances (SECURITY-1491)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
